page.title: 01Sharpness a port in country
page.content: The construction of the ship canal from Gloucester to Sharpness point in the last century (to allow navigation to Gloucester without the hazards of shifting sandbanks and the tricky bends of the river Severn resulted in the later construction of Sharpness docks. Sharpness village grew around the dock. Houses were built first round the dock itself to house port operatives (lockgate men,the harbour master etc)and then the village of Newtown Sharpness grew to house dockers, fitters and here the chapel was built. The chapel was a focus for early village life and the parish council and dock trade union still meet there.
